result.execSummary:
The defendant Dorien M Hash was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Consecutive to: 15CF400.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
Must obtain and maintain schooling and employment.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.   Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Must report to Barron County Jail immediately, to submit DNA sample.

Restitution to be determined on or before 1/31/2017
01/03/2017 AMENDED TO ADD RESTITUTION IN THE SUM OF $1101.00.
05/08/17 CORRECTED TO INDICATE THAT THE RESTITUTION IS JOINT AND SEVERAL WITH CO-DEFENDANT IN CASE NUMBER 15CF217.
